The labor market is expected to rebound at a snail’s pace.</span>
</li>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/04/protestrelated-apps-downloaded-record-rates?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Protest-Related Inventory Flies Off App Store Shelves
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Blurred faces" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjE4L2JsdXJyZWRfZmFjZXMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Signal</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like we saw in quarantine, app download patterns can be <a href="https://www.vox.com/recode/2020/6/3/21278558/protest-apps-signal-citizen-twitter-instagram-george-floyd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reshaped</a> by major global events. Now, it's the protests over police brutality and racial inequality that are shaking up the App Store. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">These apps are doing big numbers</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Citizen</strong> has been downloaded 234,000 times since May 25, according to Apptopia.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>What Citizen does: conveys location-based safety alerts in real time by funneling 911 reports to users, who can also comment and post footage. Protesters and others are probably using it to get immediate updates on demonstrations. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Signal </strong>is an encrypted messaging, calling, and video app; users are drawn to its extra layer of security. It was downloaded a record 37,000 times last weekend, and on Tuesday it became one of the top 10 most downloaded social apps on iOS for the very first time. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Not only is Signal end-to-end encrypted, it </span><span><a href="https://mashable.com/article/signal-downloads-skyrocket-nationwide-protests-george-floyd/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">can’t turn over</a></span><span> user data to law enforcement...because it doesn’t collect user data. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Yesterday, Signal announced a new tool that allows users to blur faces in the photos they post. Though it doesn’t completely anonymize photo subjects, the feature boosts the app’s privacy-first brand. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Twitter</strong> overtook rivals Facebook and Instagram, which it usually lags, in downloads earlier this week. On Wednesday, it <a href="https://twitter.com/sarafischer/status/1268571911522594818?s=12&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">smashed</a> its previous records for both downloads (677,000) and daily active users (40 million). Why? There may be no better place to get instantaneous news updates.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjIwL2FwcHRvcGlhLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Apptopia</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The</strong> <strong style="color:#000">top five police scanner apps</strong> also saw a 125% spike in downloads last weekend compared to the weekend before, <a href="https://apptopia.com/store-insights/top-charts/itunes-connect?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per Apptopia</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>These apps have seen their share of “hey-hey, ho-ho”s. Participants in last year’s Hong Kong protests used Signal and its U.K. competitor, Telegram. And protesters relied on Twitter for organizing and information-sharing in the Arab Spring and Ferguson uprisings of 2011 and 2014, respectively. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One app with a more complicated relationship to the protests? Instagram. When millions of users posted solid black squares on Tuesday and tagged #BlackLivesMatter in solidarity with protesters, they actually crowded out protest communications from organizers.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CSR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/04/businesses-match-employee-donations-racial-justice-causes?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Match That
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As more corporations pledge to fight racial inequality, consumers are demanding they <a href="https://www.vox.com/the-goods/2020/6/3/21279292/blackouttuesday-brands-solidarity-donations?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">show their receipts</a>. That pressure is moving the needle: Over the last week, companies pledged millions in the form of donations, portions of their profits, and, increasingly, matching employee donations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a public letter yesterday, Apple CEO Tim Cook <a href="https://www.apple.com/speaking-up-on-racism/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> his company would do more to fight systemic racism and injustice. Apple will donate to nonprofit groups including the Equal Justice Initiative and, for the month of June, match $2 for every $1 employees give. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Other companies offering double matching include EA, Visa, Micron, and VC giant Sequoia Capital. Companies with 1:1 matching include Google, Disney, Airbnb, and Spotify (up to $10 million). </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Some employees whose donations will be matched are encouraging others to funnel contributions through them to amplify the $$$ amount. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Matching isn’t just for the Fortune 500. </strong>Social media users, including celebrities, have been posting screenshots of their donations and <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/01/style/minnesota-freedom-fund-bail-george-floyd-protests.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">challenging</a> friends and followers to match. Those efforts helped the Minnesota Freedom Fund, a Minneapolis-based bail fund, raise $20 million in just five days.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LUXURY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/04/lvmh-reportedly-trying-renegotiate-tiffany-acquisition?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
LVMH Might Have Le Buyer’s Remorse
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="LVMH and Tiffany " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjE5L2x2bWhfYW5kX3RpZmZhbnkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s time for <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/lvmh-reviews-tiffany-prospects-luxury-081118467.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">an update</a> on French luxury conglomerate LVMH’s pending $16.2 billion acquisition of jeweler Tiffany, which has apparently hit the skids.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">LVMH is reportedly trying to restart negotiations as 1) the luxury market suffers from a loss of boutique shoppers and 2) some protests <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/lvmh-reviews-tiffany-deal-amid-coronavirus-riots-11591284202?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have led to</a> looting and vandalism in upscale retail areas.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Renegotiating would be tough—LVMH did sign the dotted line on a legal contract. In M&A, those usually include firm “no take-back” clauses. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tiffany can reportedly back out for a $575 million fee, but LVMH would have to go to court. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We haven't heard much from LVMH, but it confirmed yesterday it <em>won’t</em> buy Tiffany shares on the open market.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Why that matters: </strong></span><span>LVMH agreed to buy Tiffany in November at a price they’re both familiar with—high. Buying public Tiffany shares, now that their price has dropped during the pandemic, would be one way to push it down.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>one potential workaround is Tiffany’s debt pile, the <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/df9f9bf5-daf5-40e5-9c53-ea3f3ba41f61?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">FT reports</a>. If it misses a payment, that would give LVMH leeway to renegotiate, but that’s not looking likely: Tiffany is still issuing dividends, so it's in at least reasonable financial health. </p>

<tr>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">

<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMBLING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/04/las-vegas-casinos-reopen-large-crowds?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
"Nice Hand, Bro. Er—I Mean Elbow"
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Vegas casino" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjE3L3ZlZ2FzX2Nhc2luby5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ethan Miller/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At 12:01am yesterday, aka the middle of the afternoon Las Vegas time, Nevada’s casinos were <a href="https://apnews.com/fcb4a57e2843bb55a3b866d4ca54977e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">allowed to open</a> for the first time since March 17. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The grand reopening was marked by (what else?) a </span><span><a href="https://www.wspa.com/news/national/las-vegas-strip-casinos-reopen-with-bellagio-fountain-show/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">water fountain show</a></span><span> at the Bellagio. MGM Resorts International also joined the festivities by ringing the opening bell at the NYSE. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The pandemic has disproportionately harmed tourism-dependent states like Nevada, which hit a record-high <a href="https://www.rgj.com/story/news/2020/05/22/nevada-unemployment-rate-soars-28-2-state-down-244-800-jobs/5243949002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">28.2% unemployment rate</a> in April. So casinos and the businesses that support them were desperate to get back to work. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So what was the first day like? Let’s just say you wouldn’t know there’s a pandemic. <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1268573469542842368?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Videos</a> circulated online showed large crowds with many patrons not wearing masks (guests are encouraged, but not required to wear them; employees are).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line, </strong>per Morning Brew COO Austin Rief: The pent-up demand for casinos could be a “<a href="https://twitter.com/austin_rief/status/1268598398325751809?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bullish signal</a>” for related industries like airlines, cruises, theme parks, and more.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here: </strong>The huge tech trade show CES will take place in Vegas in 2021, say organizers. Emerging Tech Brew's Ryan Duffy explains <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/06/04/ces-2021-will-happen-las-vegas?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">why that matters</a>. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Paddle out: </strong>If you don’t know what it means to <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y5ckCAUVOn0&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">get pitted</a>, you might not know that a “paddle out” is when a group of surfers gathers in the big blue to honor someone who has died. Recently, surfers have started gathering in solidarity with protesters to honor George Floyd. Here’s an explainer from <a href="https://www.surfer.com/features/what-it-means-to-paddle-out-in-solidarity-with-black-lives-matter/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Surfer Magazine</a>, plus images from <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1268611342111473664?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Encinitas, Maui</a>, and <a href="https://patch.com/california/santamonica/photos-surfers-paddle-out-honor-george-floyd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Santa Monica</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">For 4pm today when your brain isn't working:</strong> Play this game called "<a href="https://cantunsee.space/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Can't Unsee</a>."</p>

The labor market is expected to rebound at a snail’s pace.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-trade-deficit-likely-widened-in-april-amid-coronavirus-disruptions-11591268401?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTECH\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nProtest-Related Inventory Flies Off App Store Shelves\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Blurred faces\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjE4L2JsdXJyZWRfZmFjZXMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eSignal\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike we saw in quarantine, app download patterns can be \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/recode/2020/6/3/21278558/protest-apps-signal-citizen-twitter-instagram-george-floyd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereshaped\u003c/a\u003e by major global events. Now, it's the protests over police brutality and racial inequality that are shaking up the App Store. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThese apps are doing big numbers\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCitizen\u003c/strong\u003e has been downloaded 234,000 times since May 25, according to Apptopia.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhat Citizen does: conveys location-based safety alerts in real time by funneling 911 reports to users, who can also comment and post footage. Protesters and others are probably using it to get immediate updates on demonstrations. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSignal \u003c/strong\u003eis an encrypted messaging, calling, and video app; users are drawn to its extra layer of security. It was downloaded a record 37,000 times last weekend, and on Tuesday it became one of the top 10 most downloaded social apps on iOS for the very first time. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNot only is Signal end-to-end encrypted, it \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://mashable.com/article/signal-downloads-skyrocket-nationwide-protests-george-floyd/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecan’t turn over\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e user data to law enforcement...because it doesn’t collect user data. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYesterday, Signal announced a new tool that allows users to blur faces in the photos they post. Though it doesn’t completely anonymize photo subjects, the feature boosts the app’s privacy-first brand. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTwitter\u003c/strong\u003e overtook rivals Facebook and Instagram, which it usually lags, in downloads earlier this week. On Wednesday, it \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/sarafischer/status/1268571911522594818?s=12\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esmashed\u003c/a\u003e its previous records for both downloads (677,000) and daily active users (40 million). Why? There may be no better place to get instantaneous news updates.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjIwL2FwcHRvcGlhLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"\" data-reactroot=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e \u003cem\u003eApptopia\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/small\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe\u003c/strong\u003e \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003etop five police scanner apps\u003c/strong\u003e also saw a 125% spike in downloads last weekend compared to the weekend before, \u003ca href=\"https://apptopia.com/store-insights/top-charts/itunes-connect?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper Apptopia\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThese apps have seen their share of “hey-hey, ho-ho”s. Participants in last year’s Hong Kong protests used Signal and its U.K. competitor, Telegram. And protesters relied on Twitter for organizing and information-sharing in the Arab Spring and Ferguson uprisings of 2011 and 2014, respectively. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne app with a more complicated relationship to the protests? Instagram. When millions of users posted solid black squares on Tuesday and tagged #BlackLivesMatter in solidarity with protesters, they actually crowded out protest communications from That\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs more corporations pledge to fight racial inequality, consumers are demanding they \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/the-goods/2020/6/3/21279292/blackouttuesday-brands-solidarity-donations?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshow their receipts\u003c/a\u003e. That pressure is moving the needle: Over the last week, companies pledged millions in the form of donations, portions of their profits, and, increasingly, matching employee donations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a public letter yesterday, Apple CEO Tim Cook \u003ca href=\"https://www.apple.com/speaking-up-on-racism/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e his company would do more to fight systemic racism and injustice. Apple will donate to nonprofit groups including the Equal Justice Initiative and, for the month of June, match $2 for every $1 employees give. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOther companies offering double matching include EA, Visa, Micron, and VC giant Sequoia Capital. Companies with 1:1 matching include Google, Disney, Airbnb, and Spotify (up to $10 million). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSome employees whose donations will be matched are encouraging others to funnel contributions through them to amplify the $$$ amount. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMatching isn’t just for the Fortune 500. \u003c/strong\u003eSocial media users, including celebrities, have been posting screenshots of their donations and \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/01/style/minnesota-freedom-fund-bail-george-floyd-protests.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echallenging\u003c/a\u003e friends and followers to match. Those efforts helped the Minnesota Freedom Fund, a Minneapolis-based bail fund, raise $20 million in just five days.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s time for \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/lvmh-reviews-tiffany-prospects-luxury-081118467.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ean update\u003c/a\u003e on French luxury conglomerate LVMH’s pending $16.2 billion acquisition of jeweler Tiffany, which has apparently hit the skids.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLVMH is reportedly trying to restart negotiations as 1) the luxury market suffers from a loss of boutique shoppers and 2) some protests \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/lvmh-reviews-tiffany-deal-amid-coronavirus-riots-11591284202?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave led to\u003c/a\u003e looting and vandalism in upscale retail areas.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRenegotiating would be tough—LVMH did sign the dotted line on a legal contract. In M\u0026A, those usually include firm “no take-back” clauses. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTiffany can reportedly back out for a $575 million fee, but LVMH would have to go to court. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe haven't heard much from LVMH, but it confirmed yesterday it \u003cem\u003ewon’t\u003c/em\u003e buy Tiffany shares on the open market.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy that matters: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLVMH agreed to buy Tiffany in November at a price they’re both familiar with—high. Buying public Tiffany shares, now that their price has dropped during the pandemic, would be one way to push it down.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eone potential workaround is Tiffany’s debt pile, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/df9f9bf5-daf5-40e5-9c53-ea3f3ba41f61?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eFT reports\u003c/a\u003e. If it misses a payment, that would give LVMH leeway to renegotiate, but that’s not looking likely: Tiffany is still issuing dividends, so it's in at least reasonable financial Er—I Mean Elbow\"\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Vegas casino\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjE3L3ZlZ2FzX2Nhc2luby5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eEthan Miller/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt 12:01am yesterday, aka the middle of the afternoon Las Vegas time, Nevada’s casinos were \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/fcb4a57e2843bb55a3b866d4ca54977e?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eallowed to open\u003c/a\u003e for the first time since March 17. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe grand reopening was marked by (what else?) a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wspa.com/news/national/las-vegas-strip-casinos-reopen-with-bellagio-fountain-show/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewater fountain show\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e at the Bellagio. MGM Resorts International also joined the festivities by ringing the opening bell at the NYSE. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe pandemic has disproportionately harmed tourism-dependent states like Nevada, which hit a record-high \u003ca href=\"https://www.rgj.com/story/news/2020/05/22/nevada-unemployment-rate-soars-28-2-state-down-244-800-jobs/5243949002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e28.2% unemployment rate\u003c/a\u003e in April. So casinos and the businesses that support them were desperate to get back to work. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo what was the first day like? Let’s just say you wouldn’t know there’s a pandemic. \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1268573469542842368?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eVideos\u003c/a\u003e circulated online showed large crowds with many patrons not wearing masks (guests are encouraged, but not required to wear them; employees are).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line, \u003c/strong\u003eper Morning Brew COO Austin Rief: The pent-up demand for casinos could be a “\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/austin_rief/status/1268598398325751809?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebullish signal\u003c/a\u003e” for related industries like airlines, cruises, theme parks, and more.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we're here: \u003c/strong\u003eThe huge tech trade show CES will take place in Vegas in 2021, say organizers.
